question.question_text: A car is traveling along a straight rode at a constant speed of 100mph for 5 hours calculate the total distance traveled

files.solution.html:
A car is traveling along a straight road at a constant speed of {{params.speed}} {{params.unitsSpeed}} for {{params.time}} {{params.unitsTime}}.

Calculate the total distance traveled.

1. Known Variables

The speed of the car is {{params.speed}} {{params.unitsSpeed}}.

The time of travel is {{params.time}} {{params.unitsTime}}.

2. Governing Equation

The formula for calculating the distance when an object moves at constant speed is:

$$ d = v \cdot t $$

where:

  • d is the distance traveled.
  • v is the velocity (or speed).
  • t is the time.

3. Substitution with Known Values

Substitute the given values into the equation:

$$ d = {{params.speed}} \times {{params.time}} $$

4. Calculation

Calculate the distance using the substituted values:

Assume if the units of speed are given as km/h and time in hours, the multiplication would directly give:

$$ d = {{params.speed \times params.time}} \ {{params.unitsDistance}} $$

5. Final Result

The total distance traveled by the car is:

{{params.speed \times params.time}} {{params.unitsDistance}}
